mods:mods.mods:abstract: Thinks that Peter is better informed than he about whether to sell land now farmed by Miller. Writes at length about the state constitutional convention in which Peter serves. Hasn't yet seen reports of Peter's speeches in newspaper. "I hope they have been correctly taken down by the Stenographer." Person assigned this duty for Poughkeepsie Convention of 1788 "was far from being competent." Thus only speeches for which written versions survive are reliable. As to appointment of county officers: judges should be named by Governor with assent of Senators whose district includes that county. All such appointments and votes to be entered in House Journals. "I think that no judicial offcers should be elected by the People; lest they be tempted to favor such of the Parties as can command most votes." If no other plan can be found, county judges might appoint justices of the peace, sheriff, and clerk. Discusses Grant's financial situation. Ann and Susannah Symmes arrived on 4 October.
